History of Dir previously started at least from 2”d millennium BC which gives evidence of the excavations of many burials of Aryans at Timargara and some other places, dated from 18th to 6th century BC. The area observed Gandhara Civilization after the Greeks which attained great celebrity. The Yousafzai pathans are accountable for tribal, social, political and economic life of the regions who settled here in 5th century AD. Akhund Ilyas Painda Khel of the Malaizi tribe (1640) was recognized as a religious chief and enjoyed accepted support among locals. The area Dir was isolated into two regions in particular areas lower and upper Dir having Timergara and Dir as their relevant headquarters. Dir is an important site and as a centre of Gandhara.
